name: TRANSLATE zine #7
description: It's been a good year or so, so it's about time for another issue of TRANSLATE.  This time around we go back to interview style and catch up with the likes of Restorations, Fucking Invincible, Iron Lung, Mission Of Burma, and Nate Newton about growing up, having families (or lack thereof), and trying to still find time to do this 'punk band' stuff/nonsense.  Additionally, plenty of rants as well as some comics to boot.  32 pages chock full of reading/viewing material.

name: TAXA, "Ressurection Year" 7"
description:
From Vancouver, BC comes the debut 7" from TAXA.  Brooding and bass-heavy punk in the vein of Unwound, Shotmaker, and Mission Of Burma.  Members play in Damages (React Records).  At times chaotic, other times strangely melodic with alternating male/female vocals.  But always energetic.  Check these two songs.  Comes with download card.

150- aquamarine blue
150- black

name: BLACK THROAT WIND, "Between White Worlds" CD
description:
This is a limited pressing (out of 200) CDs for Syracuse's BLACK THROAT WIND's debut full length "Between White Worlds".
Comprised of members from Oak & Bone, White Picket Fence, Current, and more they drop an epic long player full of heavy vibes, stoner rock, psychedelia, and pop melodies backed by lush piano.  Imagine the Beach Boys smokin' a load of dope, going on slow mo, and getting some distortion pedals.  Yeah, I'm releasing this.
Comes in a neat silkscreened arigato pack, as well as a wax-sealed wraparound cover and hand-numbered out of 200.  Dig it.

name: TRANSLATE #6
description:
This particular issue comes in the form of a comic book...  all drawn and written by yours truly (so if it looks like shit excuse the fact that I haven't made a comic book since high school!).  The grim nature of getting sick for an entire Winter and having little aid from medical professionals while still engaging in the typical fanfare of show going, traveling, and 'stagediving as medicine' to bring comfort to these ailing bones.  Additionally, on ongoing subtext of a blunt refusal to ever puke...  ever.  No compromise, even in the face of armageddon.  Sadness, humor, punk.
Weird cover with foldout place holder/pages pocket.
28 pages of hand-drawn wackiness

name: OAK & BONE s/t LP
description:
The debut LP from Syracuse, NY's OAK & BONE realizes a sound they have been working towards since their inception.  Their first 7" on Hex showed the rocking and groovy stoner metal vibe in a more punk fashion.  A split 7" with labelmates LIKE WOLVES last year offered a more trippy vibe to coincide with their fuzzed-out punk attack.  Now on this full length you see all sides, anchored by an overpowering bass overload and reverb-ed out guitar leads.  11 tracks of surreal heaviness and monster grooves make this an awesome first full length.  For fans of Kyuss, KARP, and Eyehategod.

Comes with a digital download coupon!

Pressing is as follows:
100- purple
900- black

name: LIKE WOLVES s/t LP
description:
Rochester, NY's LIKE WOLVES have been slugging it out for three years now.  After 2 self-released 7"s, as well as a split 7" with Hex labelmates OAK AND BONE (on Barbarossa Records), they are ready to drop their debut LP.
This album is 9 slices of raw and raging punk, full of wild, nervous energy, and more than a few nods to the angular garage-y sounds of groups like Hot Snakes and Drive Like Jehu.  A group of live wires coming unhinged, but still crafty and calculated in their approach.
Recorded live at Moresound Studio in Syracuse, NY.

Comes with digital download coupon!

Pressing is as follows:
100- orange
900- black

name: BIG DAY IN DVD- Soul Control, Like Wolves, Oak & Bone, Bridge and Tunnel
description:
Big Day In is an annual (sometimes twice a year) event in cozy Ithaca, NY where an eclectic blend of punk, indie, hardcore, and metal bands converge for a whole day of wild sounds.
This DVD captures the 2010 edition with live performances from Soul Control, Like Wolves, Oak & Bone, Bridge and Tunnel, Cattle Drums, Ghost Robot Ninja Bear, Why the Wires, Beach Parade, and many more.
As a bonus, the DVD also comes with full audio MP3s of many of the bands sets from that day.

name: PRAYERS FOR ATHEISTS, "New Hymns For An Old War" CD
description:
These Providence rockers are our buddies and we're happy to help distro their new self-released CD.
They started out with the Strange Famous/Rhymesayers collective as a politically motivated hip-hop/rock hybrid falling somewhere within the most vital elements of Rage Against the Machine and punk bare bones spirit, led by vocalist and national slam poet champ Jared Paul's raspy and commanding screeds.
Now that initial EP is behind them and this debut full length finds the band moving further into fast and catchy punk territory- a bit of later-era Clash ad Anti-Flag seeping into their sound to make for an anthemic and catchy collection of songs.  As the band puts it, "this is not just protest music, this is victory music!"
Comes in a beautiful digipack with thick lyric booklet and cool artwork.

name: TRANSLATE zine #5
description: Translate strikes back!  The brand-spankin' new issue that is a big, fat 76 1/2 size pages of nothing but interviews...  but with who?  Absolute nobodies, that's who.  This time around I chose to simply interview almost 20 of my closest friends, ask them about life, growing up, how we met, and all the simple joys in life, as well as the tough times.  Stupid kid memories, terrible high school classes, making our way across the country, having children, marriage, adult stuff, and maybe a little music because... well, it's inevitable.  Maybe you know some of these folks, but you probably don't.  So take a walk in my shoes and see what all the hub-bub is about.

name: TRANSLATE #4
description: The fourth installment of zine nerdom packed into 32 pages and wrapped in a fancy-shmancy color cover.  The upsides of cross-country travel in the name of punk rock and over-the-hill show going interspersed with the gut-churning lows of becoming a grumpy old bastard consumed with morality and death.  Plane flights, stage dives, a last will and testament and, coincidentally enough, an interview with Brooklyn post-punkers Obits.  Storytelling and cheap comics.  Deal.

name: LEMURIA, "Ozzy" 7"
description:
Second pressing of the awesome 7" from Buffalo's own Superchunk-loving, sugary sweet sounding, all around great kids in Lemuria.
Two new songs on the vinyl, as well as a third track on the download card that comes with this hunk a' wax.
Comes in a slightly scaled down package this time around, but still looks nice to the eye and sounds great to the ear.
Available in two different colors (equal amounts of each):  white and yellow so please make a note of it in your order if you're partial to that sort of thing.
Begins shipping on July 8th, 2010

name: END OF A YEAR, "More Songs About Transportation and Intercourse" 7"
description:
Another in the string of seemingly endless records for this prolific Albany-based band End Of a Year once again graces us with 2 songs, as well as a special cover song (based on the art, guess the band!) presenting an homage, of sorts, to their influences.  Comes with download card as well.
Pressing info:
200- black
200- white
100- solid green (SOLD OUT)
* Please note color preference in your order

name: THE HELM, "Home" LP
description:
This is the second full length from Seattle's The Helm!  Short, fast, and raging soul-crushing anthems of frustration and other big words describing violent and abrasive hardcore.  Yet taking twists and turns not usually associated with a 'crusty' band they toss convention aside and pound on your skull for a good 24 minutes.
Comes in a gatefold package.
Pressing info for vinyl:
400- black
500- orange
100- clear

* Please specify vinyl color choice in your order

name: THE HELM, "Home" CD
description:
This is the second full length from Seattle's The Helm!  Short, fast, and raging soul-crushing anthems of frustration and other big words describing violent and abrasive hardcore.  Yet taking twists and turns not usually associated with a 'crusty' band they toss convention aside and pound on your skull for a good 24 minutes.
CD comes in a neat eco-pack.  It's like a gatefold vinyl package...  but smaller!

name: PRIZE COUNTRY, "With Love" LP
description:
The new full length from Portland's non-stop touring hardcore rock machine.  Post-hardcore grooves and fiendish guitar work collides with rock made for gamblers and fighters.  Perhaps Jehu, Quicksand, and later-era Snapcase in a bare-knuckle bar brawl?
Comes in an an awesome gatefold package with art courtesy of Mike Wohlberg.
Here's the vinyl pressing info:
400- black
300- gray
200- clear
100- red

* In your order please specify vinyl color choice!

name: PRIZE COUNTRY, "With Love" CD
description:
The new full length from Portland's non-stop touring hardcore rock machine.  Post-hardcore grooves and fiendish guitar work collides with rock made for gamblers and fighters.  Perhaps Jehu, Quicksand, and later-era Snapcase in a bare-knuckle bar brawl?
Comes in an an awesome eco=pack (think a small version of a gatefold record cover) with art courtesy of Mike Wohlberg.

name: HEX RECORDS 10 YEAR ANNIVERSARY COMP. CD
description:
This here is a half-size zine/CD compilation celebrating 10 years of the label's history that includes tracks from everyone of the bands on the label, a bit of history about each band, their records, and the songs themselves.  Also includes a number of never-released tracks from The Helm, Building On Fire, The Funeral, Achilles, Playing Enemy, and Spark Lights the Friction.
A lot of these are being given away with bigger orders, but if you're just curious about the label and want a 26 song mix-take with great linear notes this will do just fine by itself.  And it's cheap!

name: ACHILLES, 'Hospice" LP
description:
This is the vinyl version of the amazing second full length from ACHILLES, released on Farewell Party Records.  This comes with a silkscreened, fold over cover (new artwork), and colored vinyl.

* Temporarily out of stock.  Be back soon.

name: OAK AND BONE 7"
description:
Syracuse's Oak and Bone mark their debut with a seven inch slab of vinyl recalling the best parts of dirty hardcore like Unsane or Cursed, then adding some killer 70's stoner riffs on top off it, and finally blowing your head clean off with the results.
Four songs on this one, as well as a download card that includes an extra song not on the physical copy.
Pre-orders will get first picks on vinyl color, just specify with your order.
Tracks:
1.) On Your Own Or Not At All
2.) Build Walls
3.) Atavistic
4.) Momentum
5.) Powercloud (bonus track)

Pressing info:
100 clear (SOLD OUT)
100 green (SOLD OUT)
300 black

name: NIGHT OWLS s/t CDEP
description:
Night Owls emerge on the Syracuse scene with a sound quite different than one might expect from the members of this band.  All parties have logged serious time in numerous area bands, in crappy vans, playing in random towns across the country.  Their collective experience spews forth with punchy punk rock/post-hardcore jams that have all the quick wit of a Hot Snakes set mixing with the loud cacophony of early 90's NY post-hardcore.
This EP includes 3 new songs, the original demo, as well as a live set.  Come packaged in a cool irregular-sized CD wallet thing.  Neat!

name: PLAYING ENEMY, "My Life As the Villain" CDEP
description: The final document of this Seattle noisecore three-piece wrecking unit.  Formed out of the ashes of Kiss it Goodbye, and having released two full lengths, as well as a slew of 7"s and EP's this is the last thing you'll ever see from them.  Lovingly packaged in a sweet arigato pack with a really cool design it makes for a good way to go out.  Limited pressing of 500 copies total.

name: ED GEIN, 'Judas Goats and Dieseleaters" gatefold 12"
description:
This is the vinyl version of the amazing full length that came out on Black Market Activities from this Syracuse punk/grindcore three-piece.  Ridiculously fast and technical, yet filthy and crusty enough to make you want to take a shower after listening.
This comes in a gatefold package with awesome new art from Jeremy Forson, and comes in your choice of either red/clear splatter, or brown/clear splatter (please specify when ordering if you have a preference), all on 180 gram vinyl for your listening pleasure.

name: ACHILLES, "Hospice"
description:
The ridiculously good second full length from Rochester's own Achilles.  Though way on the back burner due to members commitments with Polar Bear Club, Soul Control, and fatherhood this record gained so much praise just by how freaking good the songwriting is they didn't need to bother playing shows in support of it.
While heavily rooted in a 'mathcore' vein influences are not strictly limited to the Botch school of thought.  Add bits of Majority Rule, City Of Caterpillars, Faraquet, and straight up melodic hardcore and you get this excellent document of band with passion seeping out every pore.  Sounds delicious.

name: ENGINEER, "Reproach"
description:
The mammoth first full length from Syracuse's band of brothers, Engineer.  A sonic land leveller from start to finish this takes the monumental power and precision of bands like Neurosis and spits it out in a fashion befitting His Hero Is Gone.  Plus, they really like Knut and Burst.
Now on Black market Activities.

name: ACHILLES, 'The Dark Horse"
description: The debut full-length from Rochester's Achilles follows hot on the heels of their split dual cd with Engineer with the emphasis on intelligent and unique songwriting, blasting and compelling, a focused document of hardcore for the here and now, bound to be heralded as a progressive movement for the sound.  We are the dark horse.

name: MISTLETOE cdep
description:
Syracuse rock soldiers.  Now defunct.  Ex-members of No Idols bringing forth a love of 90's Dischord, Hot Water Music, and maybe even a little Giants Chair.
This is a limited release of 100 and all copies are hand numbered.  Packaging is all hand made as well- cut, stamped, stenciled, folded, etc.

name: NO IDOLS, "Low (Swing the Pyramid Hands" CD
description: Debut full-length from Syracuse's own politicized hardcore rockers. Like a crash course of Cursed and Queens Of the Stone Age and the lyrical bent of Endeavor expect loud and raw hardcore with a slick undercurrent of steady riffage.

name: NO IDOLS 7"
description:
The first seven inch featuring songs a bit more stripped down and punk than the LP and the original lineup.  Still has that fast rocking feel, but with a lot of speedy hardcore backing it up.
Originally released by Grave Mistake Records.

name: NO IDOLS 7" CDEP
description:
This is the CD version of the first seven inch featuring songs a bit more stripped down and punk than the LP and the original lineup.  Still has that fast rocking feel, but with a lot of speedy hardcore backing it up.
This also includes the first demo.
Originally released by Grave Mistake Records.

name: HANGING LIKE A HEX #18
description: The last issue of this long running zine and it has taken nearly 4 years to get together. Comepletly ad-free, of unusual size (6.5"x11"), and featuring articles on the mental health industry, stories about working in the mental health field, comics, interviews with Cursed and Paint It Black, and my 100 favorite records ever. To top it off it has a cool cover drawn by Mr. Mark Price.

name: HANGING LIKE A HEX #17
description:
Found!  The Ed Gein dudes had these sitting around in the literal lost maze warehouse of leftover merch they have (imagine the end scene of "Raiders Of the Lost Ark") and forked them over.  And to think, I thought these were gone for good!
This issue features a cover from Chris Mascotti (Inkling, Minor Times) and plenty of content like interviews with Bloodlet, Ted Leo, Milemarker, Suicide Note, Agoraphobic Nosebleed, Lack, Most Precious Blood; and featuring articles on the W.E.F., dumpstering, and conspiracy theories...  keep in mind, this came out in 2002 I think.  It might seem, ya know, dated.  Get it and feel the nostalgia.

name: HANGING LIKE A HEX #16
description:
The 16th issue of this long-running (and now defunct) Syracuse zine.  Features interviews with Rocket From the Crypt, Santa Sangre, Building On Fire, Walter Schiffels (Quicksand, Rival Schools), Les savy Fav, majority Rule, and more.  Also included is the popular (and now mostly obsolete) thieving article.
This issue had three different covers, so take your pick- Rob Antonucci (of Achilles, pictured), Al Columbia (artist of Fanatagraphics Pim & Francie, pictured), and Mark Reusch (popular Boston poster artist)

name: ACHILLES/ ENGINEER split 2xcd
description: Two of upstate NY's best new heavy bands deliver a handful of songs each on their own separate cd, encased in one sweet package. Achilles calls Rochester home and offer mathy hardcore power riffs from ex-Building On Fire and Standfast personnel. Syracuse's Engineer brutalize with precision noise and density, recalling the likes of Kiss It Goodbye, Anodyne, and Botch.

name: THE MINOR TIMES, "Chris Chambers Never Misses" CDEP
description:
Philly's monsterous hand of doom.  Raging Botch-metal, killing all sorts of things large and small with crazy off-time guitar and drum attack, insane screaming, yet all tied up nicely at the end.  Head scratchers beware, dullards are not safe from the fury.
This is their first release, before the LPs on Level Plane and Prosthetic.

name: INKLING, "Miscommunication" cdep
description: This is the pre-MINOR TIMES band that featured all the same members, but with a different singer.  Still in a raging math-core style of hardcore, but some more emphasis on Deftones style melody and singing to go with the Coalesce vibe of musical smashing of all things.

name: INKLING 7"
description:
This is the pre-MINOR TIMES band that featured all the same members, but with a different singer.  Still in a raging math-core style of hardcore, but some more emphasis on Deftones style melody and singing to go with the Coalesce vibe of musical smashing of all things.
This is the 7' version of the CDEP, which has two of the 5 songs from the EP

name: ED GEIN, "It's a Shame..." CDEP
description: 7 dirges of grind-hardcore madness, but with heart and conviction, and true sense of Do It Yourself ethic. A craft so honed all other bands tremble in their wake. See why the hype is deserved.

name: BUILDING ON FIRE, "Blueprint For a Space Romance" CD
description: A tumultuous torrent of spastic and progressive rock guitars, steel-trap near-powerviolence drumming, screamed vocals, and a mission to make hardcore interesting and unique.  This full-length from Rochester's own Building On Fire finds them combining many different elements to forge something new, original, and exciting through heavy hardcore, rock, samples, loops, and manic spazzcore.

name: THE NATIONAL ACROBAT, "It's Nothing Personal" 7"
description: Complete insanity from Louisville's craziest hardcore nightmare.  The music recalls everything from Botch to the Jesus Lizard, rolling heavy hardcore thunder backed by strange leads and harmonics.  Casper Adams supplies vocals only a madman could conjure up.  Lyrically obtuse and outlandish, yet wonderfully sadistic at the same time.  Some of these cats have gone on to start the Black Cross, Coliseum, and Young Widows.  Four songs here that will leave you reeling.

name: HEX COMP. 7" (ETID, Nora, Hermon DeKalb, Eternal Youth)
description: Where it all started for this label. Stuff you might have heard before from Syracuse's youth crew all-stars in Eternal Youth and Jersey destroyers Nora. Includes the Every Time I Die live classic, "Affection At Gunpoint", which is available nowhere else, as well as the last recording from the long-gone Hermon DeKalb. Get it or pose.
